Activities with artificial insemination service providers
Activities involving both women and men artificial inseminators and from Kinh, Thai and H'Mong ethnic groups aimed to equip them with high-quality skills in artificial insemination (AI) techniques, whilst ensuring AI service delivery was both professional and profitable. Activities comprised comprehensive training in the technical aspects of AI, alongside guidance on business operations. A cooperative was established to facilitate shared access to semen storage facilities, and partnerships were forged with semen suppliers to ensure a steady supply of quality genetics. Additionally, AI service providers were given booklets to track insemination procedures, monitor success rates, and assess the profitability of their services, enhancing both technical proficiency and business sustainability.
Training in the cattle AI technique, certification, and follow-on support
Training of women and men veterinary (animal health) workers and veterinarians on the technique of cattle artificial insemination was achieved through a 21 day training course (Marshall and Huyen 2023b). The course comprised both theoretical and practical sessions. Topics covered during the theoretical sessions included cattle reproduction, cattle breeding, semen including sexed semen, synchronization, heat detection, AI equipment and technique, pregnancy detection, embryo transfer, and reproductive diseases and their treatment. All theoretical sessions were interactive and all trainees were provided with a training manual (Le Thi Thanh and Marshall 2020a). The practical sessions comprised: examination and practice AI using cow uterus from different culled animals (heifers, cows etc.) provided by the slaughterhouse (Figure 5); practice AI on live cows destined for slaughter; on-farm examination of cows, synchronization and artificial insemination (Figure 6), as well as treatment of reproductive diseases. At the end of the course all trainees were examined for their skills on AI (practical) as well as theoretical understanding (oral examination). Those successfully completing the course were registered with the Animal Husbandry Research and Development Center for Mountainous Zone (ARDC - NIAS) and Issued with a certificate.
Following training, on-going support until project end was provided to the AI service providers through interactions, including field-visits, messages in Zalo group, phone-calls, and video calls, with the AI trainers. (Le Thi Thanh and Marshall 2024). This on-going support was important in ensuring the AI

treating reproductive issues.    Figure 5. Practical training on AI using cows uterus      Photos: Huyen Le Thi Thanh/NIAS   (right photo)  
   Photos: Huyen Le Thi Thanh/NIAS   Figure 6. Practical training on AI using live cows on-farm (left photo) and from a slaughterhouse   (right photo)     
   Photos: Huyen Le Thi Thanh/NIAS   (right photo)      Photos: Huyen Le Thi Thanh/NIAS   AI service providers cooperative  
Business models studies were undertaken to consider different approaches to sustainable AI service delivery within Son La Province (Bravo et al. 2023a; Bravo et al. 2023b). A key recommendation from the study was a cattle AI service providers cooperative, which would serve multiple purposes including supporting operational capacity, reducing input and equipment costs, acting as a liaison between providers and various stakeholders (such as local authorities, NGOs, input suppliers, and farmers), disseminating technical knowledge related to cattle AI, Improved breeds, and animal husbandry practices. Based on this recommendation a beef-cattle AI service providers co-operative was established, which has played a core role in this model.
The AI co-operative established comprised four members, two men and two women, belonging to the Kinh, Thai and H'Mong ethnic groups. The co-operative leader is the communal veterinary of Hat Lot town, who was an established cattle AI service provider in Mai Son District. Two other members are
Page 10 of 19

communal veterinarians of Chieng Chung and Chieng Luong communes who wanted to become AI service providers for both cows and sows. The fourth member is a director of a beef cooperative and started to do cattle AI service in Muong Bon commune. The membership size of the co-operative was determined based on expected demand for cattle AI within the Chan-Henh project sites. As demand increases, or if the approach is scaled to neighboring sites, the number of members within the co- operative could increase
All co-operative members agreed to, and signed, a common operation regulation. The aim was to ensure that the co-operative supported all members, but with members accruing individual benefits. The regulations covered issues such as: assignment of operational sub-regions assigned to each member, to ensure manageable travel distances; charges for services for uniform pricing; the semen sources to be used; sharing of group costs, for example, shipping fees; recording practices; and other practices such as advise given to farmers on cattle reproduction and AI.
A large (35-litre) liquid nitrogen tank was provided to, and managed through, the co-operative lead. Specially the lead would be responsible for importing liquid nitrogen on a weekly basis and distributing to other co-operative members, as well as semen importation as required, with payment received to cover all costs.
Additionally each members was provided with a small (3 litre) liquid nitrogen tank (to be able to transport semen on the back on motorbikes), an insemination gun (CIDR Bovine applicator) and some consumables (insemination gel, gloves, 5ml cylinders, 18 gauge needles; and synchronization hormones  PGF2 (OvuprostTM), Ovurelin) to help them launch their AI provision businesses.
On semen, experts from NIAS connected the AI co-operative members with four input suppliers for cattle AI (semen and tools) including both state and private ones. The members considered the price, breeds of available semen, way of trading, and the convenience in receiving the inputs. Based on this an individual supplier was selected. Semen is purchased by the co=operative lead as needed, and stored under liquid nitrogen until required by a co-operative member for insemination.
The signing of the common operation regulations and distribution of equipment was undertaken during a workshop (Le Thi Thanh and Marshall 2024). At this time the AI co-operative members were also introduced to farmers, village heads, leaders of communes, and representatives from the District DARD, provincial DARD; and Agricultural Service Centre.
Communications within the co-operative is facilitated by a Zalo group comprising the AI members as well as NIAS experts on artificial insemination. Discussions have included the sharing of successful AI stories, AI and synchronization issues, diagnosis and treatment of reproductive issues (including by sharing videos and photos), jointly working together to perform AIs when many are being undertaken within a commune, amongst others.
Financial management of the co-operative has been as follows. For the first three months, the project supported the co-operative through the provision of liquid nitrogen, payment of half of the semen and semen transport fees (with the other half paid by the farmer group members receiving the AI), and coverage of re-insemination fees. After this time-period, the co-operative leader has been responsible for purchasing liquid nitrogen, when reimbursement from the co-operative members based on the volumes they use. Note the liquid nitrogen price to the members was set at cost-price, but compensating for liquid nitrogen loss from the main reservoir over time.
Future activities planned by the co-operative include registration at District level, continued promotion of AI, and potentially linking with other livestock development programs to provide AI services. Future activities planned by the co-operative include registration at district level, continued promotion of AI, and potentially linking with other livestock development programs to provide AI services.
Page 11 of 19

Recording tools
To further support the AI service providers, recording booklets were created to track both artificial inseminations and business profitability. These booklets, developed in both Vietnamese and English, are referred to as the AI Service Provider Recording Booklet on Service Provision (Marshall and Le Thi 2023 c,d) and the AI Service Provider Recording Booklet for Accounting (Marshall and Le Thi, 2023 e,f).
The AI Service Provision booklet enables providers to monitor all activities related to a specific cow and its insemination (Figure 7). It includes detailed records of the client, cow, and AI-related activities, along with dates for follow-up visits and outcomes of the inseminations. Each cow that undergoes insemination has a dedicated double-page spread, facilitating easy visualization of the activities conducted for that cow, such as synchronization, heat detection, insemination, and pregnancy detection. This recording booklet empowers AI service providers to track their clients effectively, plan follow-up visits with ease, and evaluate the outcomes of the artificial insemination process.

Training in agri-business skills.
The AI service providers were additionally trained in agri-business skills with the aim of increasing their professionalism and ensuring business profitability.
The training course focused on 3 contents (Le et al. 2024):
 Training on business plans. # **You are an AI assistant tasked with evaluating research results from CGIAR (Consultative Group on International Agricultural Research) to determine whether they align with and contribute to CGIAR's objectives in poverty reduction, livelihoods, and job creation. Your goal is to accurately assign an impact area tag that reflects the relevance and impact of the research on these specific objectives.**

### **Context:**
CGIAR is a global partnership that unites international organizations focused on research for food security. CGIAR has set specific objectives to address global challenges, including poverty reduction, improving livelihoods, and job creation in developing countries. The research results you will analyze originate from various CGIAR initiatives and projects, particularly in the fields of agriculture, forestry, fisheries, climate, and nutrition.

### **Research Result Components:**
Each research result includes the following details:
- **Title:** A brief title summarizing the research result.
- **Description:** A detailed description of the research result, including methods and findings.
- **Research Abstract:** A summary of key findings and implications (optional).
- **Research Parsed Text:** The parsed text of the research result (optional).

### **Tagging Criteria:**
Assign a poverty reduction, livelihoods, and jobs impact tag using the following criteria:

- **0 = Not Targeted:** 
  - The research does not address or contribute to CGIAR's objectives in poverty reduction, livelihoods, or job creation.
  - The research is unrelated to these areas, focusing instead on different topics with no significant implications for poverty or livelihoods.
  - Example: A study focused solely on agricultural productivity without considering its impact on poverty, livelihoods, or job creation.

- **1 = Significant:** 
  - The research makes a meaningful contribution to CGIAR’s objectives in poverty reduction, livelihoods, or job creation, but these are not the primary focus.
  - The research is relevant and provides insights into these areas, but they are secondary to other goals.
  - Example: A study that explores the impact of agricultural practices on income generation, indirectly supporting poverty reduction and improving livelihoods.

- **2 = Principal:** 
  - The primary objective of the research is to address and directly impact CGIAR's goals in poverty reduction, livelihoods, or job creation.
  - The research would not have been conducted without the intention to contribute to these specific objectives.
  - Example: A study specifically designed to develop strategies for improving rural livelihoods and lifting communities out of extreme poverty.

### **Key Objectives Set by CGIAR:**
- **Poverty Alleviation:** Lifting at least 500 million people living in rural areas above the extreme poverty line of US $1.90 per day (2011 PPP).
- **Reducing Poverty:** Reducing by at least half the proportion of men, women, and children of all ages living in poverty in all its dimensions, according to national definitions.

### **Instructions:**
1. **Analyze the Title and Abstract:** Determine whether the research is related to CGIAR's objectives in poverty reduction, livelihoods, or job creation by looking for relevant keywords or phrases, such as “income generation,” “employment,” or “poverty alleviation.”
2. **Review the Description and Parsed Text:** Assess whether the research directly contributes to CGIAR’s objectives in these areas, and how integral these objectives are to the overall study.
3. **Assign the Tag:** Based on the criteria provided, assign the most appropriate tag (0, 1, or 2) that reflects whether the research is related to and impacts CGIAR’s objectives in poverty reduction, livelihoods, and job creation.
4. **Provide a Brief Justification:** Explain why you assigned this tag, referencing specific aspects of the research that influenced your decision. Make sure to clarify how the research aligns (or does not align) with CGIAR’s objectives.

### **Important Notes:**
- If the research does not relate to CGIAR's objectives in poverty reduction, livelihoods, or job creation, assign a tag of **0** (Not Targeted).
- If the research mentions these areas as important considerations but not the primary focus, assign a tag of **1** (Significant).
- If poverty reduction, livelihoods, or job creation are the primary objectives of the research, assign a tag of **2** (Principal).
- When assigning a tag of **2**, ensure that the evidence clearly demonstrates that these objectives were the main goals of the research and fundamental to its design.

Introduction
Agriculture is central to the economy and livelihoods in Vietnams Son La Province, where the mountainous terrain and tropical climate support the cultivation of crops like maize, rice, tea, and various fruits, which are key for both local consumption and trade. Livestock, particularly beef cattle, is an essential component of the agricultural system, providing income through the sale of animals, manure for soil fertility, and draft power for farming. For smallholder farmers, beef cattle production plays a crucial role in their mixed farming systems, contributing significantly to household income and food security. However, farmers face several challenges that limit productivity and profitability. These include limited access to improved cattle genetics, which could enhance meat production, and the prevalence of cattle diseases, which affect herd health and growth. Additionally, the availability of high- quality feed is often constrained, especially during the dry season, impacting cattle growth. Profitability is further hindered by market fluctuations and a lack of organized value chains, which reduce the farmers' ability to secure stable and favorable prices for their cattle. Addressing these challenges through better breeding practices, disease control, improved feeds, and enhanced market access would greatly benefit the farmers and enhance the economic potential of beef cattle production in the region. This has been the aim of the CGIAR Initiative Sustainable Animal Productivity for Livelihoods, Nutrition and Gender Inclusion (SAPLING) operating under the local project name of 'Chan- Henh' in Son La Province (Atieno et al. 2023).
Page 4 of 19

Under Chan-Henh a model was developed to promote use of artificial insemination (AI) in beef cattle. This model was developed in response to concerns from cattle farmers in Son La regarding the difficulty of finding quality breeding cattle and their high price (Le Thi Thanh and Marshall 2021a). AI has the advantage over natural mating of improving access to high quality genetics, reducing disease spread, and being cost-effective (in comparison to smallholders keeping their own bull). The adoption of beef cattle AI in Son La has traditionally been low (Hammond et al. 2010) due to both the lack of artificial insemination service providers, particularly in more remote locations, as well as lack of farmers awareness on the advantages of the technology (Le Thi Thanh and Marshall 2021a).
The model to promote the use of beef cattle AI presented here works with women and men AI service providers, women and men beef-cattle keepers, and partners including the Son La Department of Animal Health and Production, Mai Son Department of Agriculture and Rural Development, Mai Son Agricultural Service Center, and Chieng Chung, Chieng Luong, Muong Bon and Hat Lot Communal People Committees. It was tested in the Mai-Son District of Son La Province, where Chan-Henh operates. The model has been successful in both creating business opportunities in AI service provision as well as promoting AI adopting by smallholder cattle keepers, and is recommended for scaling to other locations within Son La Province and northwest Vietnam more broadly.
The Chan-Henh approach
The Chan-Henh project takes an integrated approach to improving beef cattle production and marketing, comprising: capacity building of farmers and service providers on innovations for improved beef cattle genetics, health-care and feeding; a farmers-groups approach for collective action, including on input acquisition and marketing; gender accommodative and transformative approaches to ensure innovation access and benefit is equitable; and a component to Improve nutrition of the producing households (Otieno et al. 2023). It also addresses pig production and marketing, including promotion of pig AI: the pig AI work will be reported separately.
Chan-Henh was Implemented between 2023 and 2024, within four target communes of the Mai Son District (Ching Chung , Ching Lng, Mng Bon and Ht Lt). It was funded through the One CGIAR Initiative Sustainable Animal Productivity for Livelihoods, Nutrition and Gender Inclusion (SAPLING). Permission to undertake the project was granted by the People's Committee of Son La Province on March 25th 2023 according to Decision No. 963/UBND-NC.
The project was co-designed and co-implemented with partners and stakeholders. CGIAR partners included the Alliance of Bioversity International and CIAT (the Alliance) and the International Livestock Research Institute (ILRI) and local partners included the Son La Department of Agriculture and Rural Development (Son La DARD), the Son La Sub-Department of Animal Husbandry (Son La Sub-DAH), the National Institute of Animal Sciences of Vietnam (NIAS), the National Institute of Veterinary Research (NIVR), the Northern Mountainous Agriculture and Forestry Sciences Institute (NOMAFSI), the Vietnam National University of Agriculture (VNUA) and the National institute of Nutrition (NIN).
A key element of Chan-Henh was the use of farmer groups for improved access of the smallholder farmers to input and output markets, as well as being a forum for capacity development and co-create of solutions to issues pertaining to pig and cattle keeping. Given the inefficient function of the existing farmer groups engaged in cattle and pig production in Mai Son District (in terms of economic and financial sustainability, service offers, marketing connection and trading capacity (Cuong et al. 2023), Chan-Henh focused on developing and implementing strategic plans for upgrading the functioning and capacities of the existing farmer groups, and used that lesson to support the establishment and efficient operation of new farmer groups. Since 2023, SAPLING has been assisting eight farmer groups, comprising 120 members.

The model for promotion of beef cattle artificial insemination
Overview
The model to promote cattle artificial insemination (AI) in northwest Vietnam involved: (a) building the capacity of smallholder cattle keepers on cattle breeds, breeding and artificial insemination; (b) training AI service providers in both the technical aspects of artificial insemination as well as agri-business skills and organizing these into a co-operative for shared access to centrally-located semen storage facilities; and (c) facilitating linkages between the cattle keepers and the AI service providers. A schema for the model is given in Figure 1 and more details are given below. Various resources supporting implementation of the model are freely available, as summarized in Box 1.

Activities with smallholder cattle keepers
Activities with smallholder women and men cattle keepers were aimed at increasing their capacity on, and improving their attitude towards, cattle AI. The activities comprised training on beef cattle breeds, breeding and AI, examining and treating reproductive diseases, as well as exposure to cattle AI through demonstration farms.
Training of cattle keepers on cattle breeds, breeding and AI
Training on cattle breeding, breeds and artificial insemination was achieved both through community workshop and trainings held within farmer groups. The training were a day in length and conducted by an expert team from NIAS (for the community workshops (Marshall and Le Thi Thanh 2023a) and by the Son La sub-DAH team for the farmer-group members (Son La Sub-department of Livestock Production, Animal Health and Fisheries 2024). All trainings were designed to be interactive, with group discussions and question and answer sessions. Topics included cattle breeds and their performance, the cattle reproductive cycle, how to select good breeding animals, cow heat detection, and artificial insemination, as well as taking care of pregnant and lactating cows. Materials supporting the training included posters (which remained in cultural centers (CGIAR Research Program on Livestock 2021), and training manuals which were given to each participant (Le et al. 2024 ), see Figures 2 and 3. Particular attention was paid to ensure that both women and men cattle keepers attended the training, though specifically inviting both women and men within households and ensuring that the training location was in a centralized and easy to access location. In addition to the women and men cattle keepers, local animal health care workers attended the training as well.
The respondents were very appreciative of the training, and noted that training of this nature had rarely (If ever) been offered before (Marshall and Le Thi Thanh 2023a).

Activities with artificial insemination service providers
Activities involving both women and men artificial inseminators and from Kinh, Thai and H'Mong ethnic groups aimed to equip them with high-quality skills in artificial insemination (AI) techniques, whilst ensuring AI service delivery was both professional and profitable. Activities comprised comprehensive training in the technical aspects of AI, alongside guidance on business operations. A cooperative was established to facilitate shared access to semen storage facilities, and partnerships were forged with semen suppliers to ensure a steady supply of quality genetics. Additionally, AI service providers were given booklets to track insemination procedures, monitor success rates, and assess the profitability of their services, enhancing both technical proficiency and business sustainability.
Training in the cattle AI technique, certification, and follow-on support
Training of women and men veterinary (animal health) workers and veterinarians on the technique of cattle artificial insemination was achieved through a 21 day training course (Marshall and Huyen 2023b). The course comprised both theoretical and practical sessions. Topics covered during the theoretical sessions included cattle reproduction, cattle breeding, semen including sexed semen, synchronization, heat detection, AI equipment and technique, pregnancy detection, embryo transfer, and reproductive diseases and their treatment. All theoretical sessions were interactive and all trainees were provided with a training manual (Le Thi Thanh and Marshall 2020a). The practical sessions comprised: examination and practice AI using cow uterus from different culled animals (heifers, cows etc.) provided by the slaughterhouse (Figure 5); practice AI on live cows destined for slaughter; on-farm examination of cows, synchronization and artificial insemination (Figure 6), as well as treatment of reproductive diseases. At the end of the course all trainees were examined for their skills on AI (practical) as well as theoretical understanding (oral examination). Those successfully completing the course were registered with the Animal Husbandry Research and Development Center for Mountainous Zone (ARDC - NIAS) and Issued with a certificate.
Following training, on-going support until project end was provided to the AI service providers through interactions, including field-visits, messages in Zalo group, phone-calls, and video calls, with the AI trainers. (Le Thi Thanh and Marshall 2024). This on-going support was important in ensuring the AI
Page 9 of 19

  
treating reproductive issues.    Figure 5. Practical training on AI using cows uterus      Photos: Huyen Le Thi Thanh/NIAS   (right photo)  
   Photos: Huyen Le Thi Thanh/NIAS   Figure 6. Practical training on AI using live cows on-farm (left photo) and from a slaughterhouse   (right photo)     
   Photos: Huyen Le Thi Thanh/NIAS   (right photo)      Photos: Huyen Le Thi Thanh/NIAS   AI service providers cooperative  
Business models studies were undertaken to consider different approaches to sustainable AI service delivery within Son La Province (Bravo et al. 2023a; Bravo et al. 2023b). A key recommendation from the study was a cattle AI service providers cooperative, which would serve multiple purposes including supporting operational capacity, reducing input and equipment costs, acting as a liaison between providers and various stakeholders (such as local authorities, NGOs, input suppliers, and farmers), disseminating technical knowledge related to cattle AI, Improved breeds, and animal husbandry practices. Based on this recommendation a beef-cattle AI service providers co-operative was established, which has played a core role in this model.
The AI co-operative established comprised four members, two men and two women, belonging to the Kinh, Thai and H'Mong ethnic groups. The co-operative leader is the communal veterinary of Hat Lot town, who was an established cattle AI service provider in Mai Son District. Two other members are
Page 10 of 19

communal veterinarians of Chieng Chung and Chieng Luong communes who wanted to become AI service providers for both cows and sows. The fourth member is a director of a beef cooperative and started to do cattle AI service in Muong Bon commune. The membership size of the co-operative was determined based on expected demand for cattle AI within the Chan-Henh project sites. As demand increases, or if the approach is scaled to neighboring sites, the number of members within the co- operative could increase
All co-operative members agreed to, and signed, a common operation regulation. The aim was to ensure that the co-operative supported all members, but with members accruing individual benefits. The regulations covered issues such as: assignment of operational sub-regions assigned to each member, to ensure manageable travel distances; charges for services for uniform pricing; the semen sources to be used; sharing of group costs, for example, shipping fees; recording practices; and other practices such as advise given to farmers on cattle reproduction and AI.
A large (35-litre) liquid nitrogen tank was provided to, and managed through, the co-operative lead. Specially the lead would be responsible for importing liquid nitrogen on a weekly basis and distributing to other co-operative members, as well as semen importation as required, with payment received to cover all costs.
Additionally each members was provided with a small (3 litre) liquid nitrogen tank (to be able to transport semen on the back on motorbikes), an insemination gun (CIDR Bovine applicator) and some consumables (insemination gel, gloves, 5ml cylinders, 18 gauge needles; and synchronization hormones  PGF2 (OvuprostTM), Ovurelin) to help them launch their AI provision businesses.
On semen, experts from NIAS connected the AI co-operative members with four input suppliers for cattle AI (semen and tools) including both state and private ones. The members considered the price, breeds of available semen, way of trading, and the convenience in receiving the inputs. Based on this an individual supplier was selected. Semen is purchased by the co=operative lead as needed, and stored under liquid nitrogen until required by a co-operative member for insemination.
The signing of the common operation regulations and distribution of equipment was undertaken during a workshop (Le Thi Thanh and Marshall 2024). At this time the AI co-operative members were also introduced to farmers, village heads, leaders of communes, and representatives from the District DARD, provincial DARD; and Agricultural Service Centre.
Communications within the co-operative is facilitated by a Zalo group comprising the AI members as well as NIAS experts on artificial insemination. Discussions have included the sharing of successful AI stories, AI and synchronization issues, diagnosis and treatment of reproductive issues (including by sharing videos and photos), jointly working together to perform AIs when many are being undertaken within a commune, amongst others.
Financial management of the co-operative has been as follows. For the first three months, the project supported the co-operative through the provision of liquid nitrogen, payment of half of the semen and semen transport fees (with the other half paid by the farmer group members receiving the AI), and coverage of re-insemination fees. After this time-period, the co-operative leader has been responsible for purchasing liquid nitrogen, when reimbursement from the co-operative members based on the volumes they use. Note the liquid nitrogen price to the members was set at cost-price, but compensating for liquid nitrogen loss from the main reservoir over time.
Future activities planned by the co-operative include registration at District level, continued promotion of AI, and potentially linking with other livestock development programs to provide AI services. Recording tools
To further support the AI service providers, recording booklets were created to track both artificial inseminations and business profitability. These booklets, developed in both Vietnamese and English, are referred to as the AI Service Provider Recording Booklet on Service Provision (Marshall and Le Thi 2023 c,d) and the AI Service Provider Recording Booklet for Accounting (Marshall and Le Thi, 2023 e,f).
The AI Service Provision booklet enables providers to monitor all activities related to a specific cow and its insemination (Figure 7). It includes detailed records of the client, cow, and AI-related activities, along with dates for follow-up visits and outcomes of the inseminations. Each cow that undergoes insemination has a dedicated double-page spread, facilitating easy visualization of the activities conducted for that cow, such as synchronization, heat detection, insemination, and pregnancy detection. This recording booklet empowers AI service providers to track their clients effectively, plan follow-up visits with ease, and evaluate the outcomes of the artificial insemination process.

# **You are an AI assistant tasked with evaluating research results from CGIAR (Consultative Group on International Agricultural Research) to determine whether they align with and contribute to CGIAR's objectives in promoting gender equality. Your goal is to accurately assign an impact area tag that reflects the relevance and impact of the research on these specific gender equality objectives.**

### **Context:**
CGIAR is a global partnership that unites international organizations focused on research for food security. CGIAR has established specific objectives to promote gender equality, particularly in the fields of agriculture, forestry, fisheries, climate, and nutrition in developing countries. The research results you will analyze originate from various CGIAR initiatives and projects in these and related fields.

### **Research Result Components:**
Each research result includes the following details:
- **Title:** A brief title summarizing the research result.
- **Description:** A detailed description of the research result, including methods and findings.
- **Research Abstract:** A summary of key findings and implications (optional).
- **Research Parsed Text:** The parsed text of the research result (optional).

### **Tagging Criteria:**
Assign a gender equality impact tag using the following criteria:

- **0 = Not Targeted:** 
  - The research does not address or contribute to CGIAR's gender equality objectives.
  - The research is unrelated to gender equality, focusing instead on different topics with no significant implications for gender-related issues.
  - Example: A study focused solely on crop yield improvements without considering gender roles, implications, or disparities.

- **1 = Significant:**
  - The research makes a meaningful contribution to CGIAR’s gender equality objectives, but these are not the primary focus.
  - The research is relevant and provides insights into gender dynamics, but these are secondary to other goals.
  - Example: A study that examines the impact of agricultural interventions on women’s access to land but does not center its entire analysis on gender equality.

- **2 = Principal:**
  - The primary objective of the research is to address and directly impact CGIAR's goals in promoting gender equality.
  - The research would not have been undertaken without the intention to contribute to these specific gender equality objectives.
  - Example: A study specifically designed to develop agricultural policies aimed at improving women’s access to financial resources and closing gender gaps.

### **Key Objectives Set by CGIAR:**
- **Closing the Gender Gap:** Addressing disparities in rights to economic resources, ownership, and control over land and natural resources for women in food, land, and water systems.
- **Providing Opportunities:** Creating opportunities for young people who are not in employment, education, or training, with a focus on gender inclusivity.

### **Instructions:**
1. **Analyze the Title and Abstract:** Determine whether the research is related to CGIAR's objectives in promoting gender equality by looking for relevant keywords or phrases, such as “gender,” “women,” “equality,” or “empowerment.”
2. **Review the Description and Parsed Text:** Assess whether the research directly contributes to CGIAR’s gender equality objectives, and how integral these objectives are to the overall study.
3. **Assign the Tag:** Based on the criteria provided, assign the most appropriate tag (0, 1, or 2) that reflects whether the research is related to and impacts CGIAR’s objectives in gender equality.
4. **Provide a Brief Justification:** Explain why you assigned this tag, referencing specific aspects of the research that influenced your decision. Make sure to clarify how the research aligns (or does not align) with CGIAR’s gender equality objectives.

### **Important Notes:**
- If the research does not relate to CGIAR's objectives in gender equality, assign a tag of **0** (Not Targeted).
- If the research mentions gender equality as an important consideration but not the primary focus, assign a tag of **1** (Significant).
- If gender equality is the primary objective of the research, assign a tag of **2** (Principal).
- When assigning a tag of **2**, ensure that the evidence clearly demonstrates that gender equality objectives were the main goals of the research and fundamental to its design.

### **Structured Output Format:**
Please provide your answer in the following format:
{ "score": <0|1|2>, "explanation": "<Your explanation here>" }

En el marco de la alianza entre Agrosavia, ASOANEI y Agrilac, este ltimo entreg un protocolo para ser implementado por representantes de la comunidad arhuaca, que incluye el sondeo de mercados, la bsqueda de informacin secundaria, la observacin en puntos de venta sirvi como aporte para la construccin del PLACEBA. El Plan de Comercializacin y Emprendimiento para productos biofortificados Arhuacos  PLACEBA, es una propuesta que combina la generacin de estrategias de mercadeo de los productos tnicos, con la formacin en emprendimiento para los miembros de las comunidades indgenas Arhuacos en el departamento de Cesar en el norte de Colombia, con el fin de fortalecer capacidades para la creacin de empresas individuales o colectivas, lideradas por mujeres indgenas (en lo posible) bajo el modelo productivo agroecolgico intercultural, el cual se centra en cultivos bsicos como el maz, la batata, el frijol y la yuca, todos con una caracterstica en comn: que son productos biofortificados con mayores contenidos nutricionales que otros alimentos, para combatir la malnutricin en las comunidades locales. La propuesta PLACEBA adems de promover el autoconsumo, busca tambin consolidar el agronegocio a travs de un plan de vinculacin tecnolgica con enfoque tnico y de gnero, donde las comunidades indgenas (con nfasis en la participacin de las mujeres), se integren como protagonistas en los sistemas agroalimentarios en diversos eslabones como la produccin, transformacin y comercializacin de estos alimentos biofortificados promovidos por la iniciativa Agrilac Resiliente en el departamento de Cesar en alianza con AGROSAVIA. Se pretende tambin, incrementar los indicadores de autonoma alimentaria del pueblo Arhuaco en comunidades priorizadas por su estado nutricional precario, a partir de la difusin del frjol biofortificado y favorecer la venta de excedentes a precios justos, debida a la disminucin de la intermediacin. Dadas las caractersticas de la tecnologa local de produccin del pueblo Arhuaco, el incremento en reas sembradas no afectar la generacin de emisiones de gases de efecto invernadero en las zonas cultivadas con frjol. Asimismo, se mejorar la articulacin econmica del pueblo originario con su entorno regional, a partir de las ventas resultantes de un esquema comercial de ciclo corto basado en las Tecnologas de la Informacin y las Comunicaciones (TIC) y la promocin en redes sociales.
El PLACEBA rene un conjunto de estrategias que permitirn orientar a las comunidades del pueblo Arhuaco y las instituciones aliadas para identificar y alcanzar sus objetivos en un tiempo determinado. En la figura 1, se describen los principales componentes de un plan de comercializacin, que a su vez debe considerar la descripcin general del emprendimiento, determinar el punto de partida o situacin actual, establecer los objetivos comerciales, el mercado objetivo y las estrategias comerciales para lograr los objetivos en determinado tiempo (trimestral, semestral o anual), estableciendo la ruta de accin y seguimiento. Adems, este plan de comercializacin debe coincidir con los enfoques del emprendimiento, por lo cual es necesario incluir la generacin de la misin y visin en esta fase en el proceso con la poblacin diferencial indgena.

Justificacin
El departamento del Cesar, ubicado en la regin Caribe de Colombia, enfrenta grandes desafos socioeconmicos pues 22,82% de la poblacin tiene necesidades bsicas insatisfechas; 7,17% se encuentra en el nivel de miseria (DANE, 2019) y el desempleo rural es significativamente superior al promedio nacional. Estas condiciones afectan especialmente a las comunidades indgenas, donde la vulnerabilidad econmica se traduce en una baja autonoma alimentaria y una escasa participacin en los mercados locales y regionales. Frente a esta situacin, el proyecto "plan de vinculacin de sistemas hortcolas de produccin familiar en la regin, en su segunda fase y en convenio con AgriLAC Resiliente, se plantea como una respuesta integral para fortalecer la soberana alimentaria de estas comunidades a travs de la promocin, el autoconsumo, transformacin y la comercializacin de una canasta de alimentos biofortificados bajo tecnologas ambientalmente sustentables. Al respecto, el protocolo Autnomo Mandato- del Pueblo Arhuaco- de la Sierra Nevada de Santa Marta (SNSM) para el relacionamiento con el mundo externo incluyendo la consulta y el consentimiento previo, libre e informado establece los mnimos y los mximos de las actuaciones permitidas en el territorio ancestral y sagrado de la SNSM de acuerdo con la ley de origen, con el fin de garantizar la proteccin del territorio como un todo desde la concepcin ancestral. Este protocolo establecido para los bunachu, indica que queda prohibida la venta de los productos agroqumicos dentro del territorio ancestral (CIT, 2017). Se impulsar la utilizacin de los mecanismos tradicionales para control de las malezas y plagas. Es por esto, que las acciones de Agrilac han promovido la integracin del saber ancestral con las prcticas agroecolgicas para tejer un conocimiento intercultural compatible con la conservacin de las zonas de vida del pueblo Arhuaco.
Con la adenda de esta iniciativa, AgriLAC en convenio con AGROSAVIA, se proponen objetivos que permitan validar nuevas tecnologas que mejoren la nutricin, desarrollando un enfoque integral que combina prcticas ancestrales, agroecolgicas y convencionales. De hecho, a travs de la implementacin de herramientas SET, se busc analizar el desempeo productivo de las parcelas demostrativas y, mediante un enfoque participativo, generar recomendaciones para mejorar la eficiencia y sostenibilidad de los sistemas productivos.

El PLACEBA, tambin se basa en el anlisis de la demanda del frijol biofortificado, explorando alternativas viables para su posicionamiento en mercados locales y regionales. Mediante talleres de emprendimiento, se ha desarrollado un prototipo de producto que utiliza materias primas locales, con el fin de diversificar las opciones comerciales y mejorar la competitividad en el mercado. Asimismo, el componente de mercados afina las estrategias para integrar un enfoque agroecolgico que responda a las necesidades del consumidor local, incentivando la eleccin de productos biofortificados.
Con este enfoque, el objetivo del PLACEBA no es slo la mejora de los ingresos econmicos de las familias rurales del Cesar, sino tambin el empoderamiento de las comunidades indgenas, promoviendo la inclusin social y econmica, la conservacin de los conocimientos ancestrales y la adopcin de nuevas tecnologas agroecolgicas para una produccin sostenible y resiliente (figura 2).

Antecedentes
El departamento del Cesar es un territorio vulnerable a la variabilidad climtica, afectado por este fenmeno en 47,8% de su rea. En este sentido, son numerosos los registros de deterioro ambiental por actividad antrpica, alta susceptibilidad al cambio y variabilidad climtica en el Caribe seco, al igual que la inseguridad alimentaria durante las temporadas ms secas del ao (CORPOICA-MAPA, 2015). La ecorregin Sierra nevada es un ambiente megadiverso donde se presentan todos los pisos trmicos. Sin embargo, se han registrado fuertes conflictos ambientales especialmente en el uso agrcola del suelo y en la disminucin de la oferta hdrica superficial en algunas temporadas del ao (Hoyos et al., 2019). El pueblo Arhuaco est ubicado a lo largo de todas las zonas de vida de la SNSM y recibi semilla certificada de AGROSAVIA en el ao 2018 (Figura 3). En el ejercicio de autonoma y autodeterminacin han conservado la semilla y a la fecha continan sembrado la variedad de frjol biofortificado AGROSAVIA rojo 43, variedad que se ha mantenido en campo en un rango de siembra entre 600 a 2.200 msnm. La ubicacin de la variedad en zonas de baja vocacin agrcola o donde la oferta bioclimtica es inadecuada para el frjol, recrudece los problemas ambientales detectados en la Sierra nevada y dificulta la aplicacin de estrategias de produccin agroecolgica. ASOCIT (Asociacin de Autoridades arhuacas), cuenta con un portafolio de productos agroindustriales (cacao, caf, panela) que algunas asociaciones arhuacas han registrado ante el Ministerio de Agricultura y Desarrollo Rural (MADR) como operadores con sello ecolgico (0187 del 2006) con certificadores como BCS KO GARANTIE, lo cual ha permitido la exportacin e ingreso a mercados especializados nacionales y regionales. Por tal razn, se pretende aprovechar esta capacidad endgena construida en otros cultivos y ampliarla al frjol biofortificado AGROSAVIA rojo 43.
Bajo el anterior contexto, en 2022 AgriLAC Resiliente, -una iniciativa del CGIAR para aumentar resiliencia, sostenibilidad y competitividad en Amrica Latina y el Caribe, inicia un acercamiento con Asociacin De Productores Agro Ecolgicos Indgenas Y Campesinos De Las Sierra Nevada De Santa Marta Y Serrana Del Perij ASOANEI para realizar un sondeo rpido de mercado local con la asociacin del cultivo de frjol para identificar conexiones con mercados (ASOANEI y su grupo de inters), articulacin con los enlaces de mercadeo de Agrosavia y del programa de Biofortificados. El protocolo de sondeo rpido tiene como objetivo definir un set de herramientas y/o mtodos para explorar las condiciones de la demanda (asociadas con oportunidades del mercado) de frjol en sistemas alimentarios locales y regionales, con el fin de obtener informacin de los mercados potenciales, clientes y oportunidades de negocio que permita establecer polticas, objetivos y estrategias alrededor del negocio del

Por otro lado, teniendo en cuenta las particularidades de este pueblo ancestral se incluyeron aspectos como economa propia a nivel del resguardo o listado de inters con actores del territorio que gener un reporte con recomendaciones generales sobre el modelo de mercado. En mayor detalle, la colaboracin entre el equipo de mercado de la Alianza Bioversity - CIAT y el departamento de mercadeo de tecnologas de AGROSAVIA gener una propuesta de sondeo rpido de mercado para su aplicacin por jvenes de ASOANEI. La estrategia incluy dos talleres virtuales a cargo del personal tcnico de ambas instituciones. A partir de este acercamiento se gener un protocolo que se comparti con ASOANEI para que esa entidad priorizara las acciones a realizar como la visita a cuatro supermercados relevantes en Valledupar para la evaluacin de marcas, presentaciones y valores de frjol seco en los diferentes mercados de Valledupar por jvenes Arhuacas del Semillero Fondo Accin de la comunidad Umuriwa. Uno de los principales resultados fue la identificacin de la comercializacin de la variedad biofortificada en uno de los supermercados regionales en un empaque genrico que no reflejaba la promesa de valor nutricional ni su produccin local por la asociacin Asoproagrogar de la Mesa Valledupar. Estn regidos por la Ley de origen, por lo cual solo aceptan manejos agroecolgicos en su territorio, viven en la Sierra Nevada de Santa Marta y estn sensibilizados con el desarrollo de actividades propias de su modelo econmico (trueques, mingas) o con la venta de excedentes de cosechas de cultivos agroindustriales como el cacao, la caa y el caf. Teniendo en cuenta que este proyecto incluye un modelo intercultural basado en la Ley de origen, otros grupos tnicos como los Kankuamos asentados en los municipios con reas aptas para frijol en La Sierra Nevada en los municipios de Pueblo Bello y Valledupar tambin podran ser considerados como beneficiarios indirectos, pues se rigen por la misma ley de origen y tienen problemas de desnutricin. El 92,3% de la poblacin est asentada en el Cesar, Pueblo Bello (12.180) y Valledupar (8.169), Fundacin (5.133); en Magdalena en Aracataca (2.770) y Santa Marta (2.183); mientras que en Guajira se registran en Dibulla (1.595). Del total poblacional el 35, 2% son analfabetas y 76, 2% habla su lengua nativa (DANE, 2019). Adicional a esto, la poblacin arhuaca reporta ndices significativos de desnutricin crnica y aguda. De acuerdo con lo anterior, tienen una alta dependencia de la gobernanza regional y nacional para la donacin de granos de la canasta bsica, que incluye el frjol comn y, por tanto, se reciben granos forneos sin trazabilidad productiva y con inocuidad indeterminada, lo cual afecta el estado de salud de las comunidades vulnerables y en especial de los nios. A partir del PLACEBA se pretende limitar la dependencia del suministro estatal de frjol, al producir en el territorio un grano con trazabilidad y en concordancia con la cosmovisin de la etnia. La variedad mejorada de frjol biofortificado con alta adaptacin a la sequa y a las pudriciones y virosis produce 40% ms que las variedades locales, ya ha sido aceptada por la comunidad y bautizada por el mamo o autoridad espiritual para su uso en el resguardo. De la mano con las actividades de produccin agroecolgica, se contempla la capacitacin a los asistentes tcnicos tnicos en la produccin local de semilla con calidad para evitar la diseminacin de las enfermedades transmitidas por semilla de mala calidad. Adems, ya que la sanidad e inocuidad provienen del campo, es necesario establecer normas de comercio justo y tico para disminuir la dependencia del suministro de granos forneos y promover la articulacin econmica del resguardo con el territorio, a travs de la oferta de un producto empacado bajo el cumplimiento de la norma sanitaria y su correspondiente registro. Este proceso facilitar el cumplimiento de la NTC871 y el CONPES 3514 del 2008.
La articulacin del producto con el mercado se facilitar pues se cambiar el esquema de venta a granel de grano de frjol sin clasificar, junto con un esquema de intermediacin regional alto en el que participan entre 4 y 5 acaparadores antes de llegar al consumidor. Se obtendr un producto con valor agregado por el sistema de produccin que cuida la inocuidad del grano, un producto de alto valor nutricional y una agroindustria rural para la seleccin y empaque de frjol biofortificado en presentaciones de 1 kg.
El mercado de productos biofortificados puede dirigirse a segmentos conscientes de la salud, programas institucionales de alimentacin, y consumidores interesados en la sostenibilidad. El proyecto Fase 2 del Plan de Vinculacin en Sistemas hortcolas de produccin familiar en el Caribe tiene como objetivo la produccin no slo de frjol biofortificado, sino tambin de otros biofortificados en un contexto agroecolgico. Para el caso de este tipo de frijol, es una opcin nutricionalmente superior y busca introducirse en la canasta bsica alimentaria de la regin Caribe. El plan de comercializacin debe enfocarse en la diferenciacin de productos biofortificados por sus beneficios para la nutrici

# **You are an AI assistant tasked with evaluating research results from CGIAR (Consultative Group on International Agricultural Research) to determine whether they align with and contribute to CGIAR's objectives in promoting gender equality. Your goal is to accurately assign an impact area tag that reflects the relevance and impact of the research on these specific gender equality objectives.**

### **Context:**
CGIAR is a global partnership that unites international organizations focused on research for food security. CGIAR has established specific objectives to promote gender equality, particularly in the fields of agriculture, forestry, fisheries, climate, and nutrition in developing countries. The research results you will analyze originate from various CGIAR initiatives and projects in these and related fields.

### **Research Result Components:**
Each research result includes the following details:
- **Title:** A brief title summarizing the research result.
- **Description:** A detailed description of the research result, including methods and findings.
- **Research Abstract:** A summary of key findings and implications (optional).
- **Research Parsed Text:** The parsed text of the research result (optional).

### **Tagging Criteria:**
Assign a gender equality impact tag using the following criteria:

- **0 = Not Targeted:** 
  - The research does not address or contribute to CGIAR's gender equality objectives.
  - The research is unrelated to gender equality, focusing instead on different topics with no significant implications for gender-related issues.
  - Example: A study focused solely on crop yield improvements without considering gender roles, implications, or disparities.

- **1 = Significant:**
  - The research makes a meaningful contribution to CGIAR’s gender equality objectives, but these are not the primary focus.
  - The research is relevant and provides insights into gender dynamics, but these are secondary to other goals.
  - Example: A study that examines the impact of agricultural interventions on women’s access to land but does not center its entire analysis on gender equality.

- **2 = Principal:**
  - The primary objective of the research is to address and directly impact CGIAR's goals in promoting gender equality.
  - The research would not have been undertaken without the intention to contribute to these specific gender equality objectives.
  - Example: A study specifically designed to develop agricultural policies aimed at improving women’s access to financial resources and closing gender gaps.

### **Key Objectives Set by CGIAR:**
- **Closing the Gender Gap:** Addressing disparities in rights to economic resources, ownership, and control over land and natural resources for women in food, land, and water systems.
- **Providing Opportunities:** Creating opportunities for young people who are not in employment, education, or training, with a focus on gender inclusivity.

### **Instructions:**
1. **Analyze the Title and Abstract:** Determine whether the research is related to CGIAR's objectives in promoting gender equality by looking for relevant keywords or phrases, such as “gender,” “women,” “equality,” or “empowerment.”
2. **Review the Description and Parsed Text:** Assess whether the research directly contributes to CGIAR’s gender equality objectives, and how integral these objectives are to the overall study.
3. **Assign the Tag:** Based on the criteria provided, assign the most appropriate tag (0, 1, or 2) that reflects whether the research is related to and impacts CGIAR’s objectives in gender equality.
4. **Provide a Brief Justification:** Explain why you assigned this tag, referencing specific aspects of the research that influenced your decision. Make sure to clarify how the research aligns (or does not align) with CGIAR’s gender equality objectives.

### **Important Notes:**
- If the research does not relate to CGIAR's objectives in gender equality, assign a tag of **0** (Not Targeted).
- If the research mentions gender equality as an important consideration but not the primary focus, assign a tag of **1** (Significant).
- If gender equality is the primary objective of the research, assign a tag of **2** (Principal).
- When assigning a tag of **2**, ensure that the evidence clearly demonstrates that gender equality objectives were the main goals of the research and fundamental to its design.

### **Structured Output Format:**
Please provide your answer in the following format:
{ "score": <0|1|2>, "explanation": "<Your explanation here>" }

Be careful to determine whether the research is truly aligned with CGIAR's specific goals in promoting gender equality.**

El Plan de Comercializacin y Emprendimiento para productos biofortificados Arhuacos  PLACEBA, es una propuesta que combina la generacin de estrategias de mercadeo de los productos tnicos, con la formacin en emprendimiento para los miembros de las comunidades indgenas Arhuacos en el departamento de Cesar en el norte de Colombia, con el fin de fortalecer capacidades para la creacin de empresas individuales o colectivas, lideradas por mujeres indgenas (en lo posible) bajo el modelo productivo agroecolgico intercultural, el cual se centra en cultivos bsicos como el maz, la batata, el frijol y la yuca, todos con una caracterstica en comn: que son productos biofortificados con mayores contenidos nutricionales que otros alimentos, para combatir la malnutricin en las comunidades locales. La propuesta PLACEBA adems de promover el autoconsumo, busca tambin consolidar el agronegocio a travs de un plan de vinculacin tecnolgica con enfoque tnico y de gnero, donde las comunidades indgenas (con nfasis en la participacin de las mujeres), se integren como protagonistas en los sistemas agroalimentarios en diversos eslabones como la produccin, transformacin y comercializacin de estos alimentos biofortificados promovidos por la iniciativa Agrilac Resiliente en el departamento de Cesar en alianza con AGROSAVIA. Se pretende tambin, incrementar los indicadores de autonoma alimentaria del pueblo Arhuaco en comunidades priorizadas por su estado nutricional precario, a partir de la difusin del frjol biofortificado y favorecer la venta de excedentes a precios justos, debida a la disminucin de la intermediacin. Dadas las caractersticas de la tecnologa local de produccin del pueblo Arhuaco, el incremento en reas sembradas no afectar la generacin de emisiones de gases de efecto invernadero en las zonas cultivadas con frjol. Asimismo, se mejorar la articulacin econmica del pueblo originario con su entorno regional, a partir de las ventas resultantes de un esquema comercial de ciclo corto basado en las Tecnologas de la Informacin y las Comunicaciones (TIC) y la promocin en redes sociales.
El PLACEBA rene un conjunto de estrategias que permitirn orientar a las comunidades del pueblo Arhuaco y las instituciones aliadas para identificar y alcanzar sus objetivos en un tiempo determinado. En la figura 1, se describen los principales componentes de un plan de comercializacin, que a su vez debe considerar la descripcin general del emprendimiento, determinar el punto de partida o situacin actual, establecer los objetivos comerciales, el mercado objetivo y las estrategias comerciales para lograr los objetivos en determinado tiempo (trimestral, semestral o anual), estableciendo la ruta de accin y seguimiento. Adems, este plan de comercializacin debe coincidir con los enfoques del emprendimiento, por lo cual es necesario incluir la generacin de la misin y visin en esta fase en el proceso con la poblacin diferencial indgena.

Justificacin
El departamento del Cesar, ubicado en la regin Caribe de Colombia, enfrenta grandes desafos socioeconmicos pues 22,82% de la poblacin tiene necesidades bsicas insatisfechas; 7,17% se encuentra en el nivel de miseria (DANE, 2019) y el desempleo rural es significativamente superior al promedio nacional. Estas condiciones afectan especialmente a las comunidades indgenas, donde la vulnerabilidad econmica se traduce en una baja autonoma alimentaria y una escasa participacin en los mercados locales y regionales. Frente a esta situacin, el proyecto "plan de vinculacin de sistemas hortcolas de produccin familiar en la regin, en su segunda fase y en convenio con AgriLAC Resiliente, se plantea como una respuesta integral para fortalecer la soberana alimentaria de estas comunidades a travs de la promocin, el autoconsumo, transformacin y la comercializacin de una canasta de alimentos biofortificados bajo tecnologas ambientalmente sustentables. Al respecto, el protocolo Autnomo Mandato- del Pueblo Arhuaco- de la Sierra Nevada de Santa Marta (SNSM) para el relacionamiento con el mundo externo incluyendo la consulta y el consentimiento previo, libre e informado establece los mnimos y los mximos de las actuaciones permitidas en el territorio ancestral y sagrado de la SNSM de acuerdo con la ley de origen, con el fin de garantizar la proteccin del territorio como un todo desde la concepcin ancestral. Este protocolo establecido para los bunachu, indica que queda prohibida la venta de los productos agroqumicos dentro del territorio ancestral (CIT, 2017). Se impulsar la utilizacin de los mecanismos tradicionales para control de las malezas y plagas. Es por esto, que las acciones de Agrilac han promovido la integracin del saber ancestral con las prcticas agroecolgicas para tejer un conocimiento intercultural compatible con la conservacin de las zonas de vida del pueblo Arhuaco.
Con la adenda de esta iniciativa, AgriLAC en convenio con AGROSAVIA, se proponen objetivos que permitan validar nuevas tecnologas que mejoren la nutricin, desarrollando un enfoque integral que combina prcticas ancestrales, agroecolgicas y convencionales. De hecho, a travs de la implementacin de herramientas SET, se busc analizar el desempeo productivo de las parcelas demostrativas y, mediante un enfoque participativo, generar recomendaciones para mejorar la eficiencia y sostenibilidad de los sistemas productivos.

Mediante talleres de emprendimiento, se ha desarrollado un prototipo de producto que utiliza materias primas locales, con el fin de diversificar las opciones comerciales y mejorar la competitividad en el mercado. Asimismo, el componente de mercados afina las estrategias para integrar un enfoque agroecolgico que responda a las necesidades del consumidor local, incentivando la eleccin de productos biofortificados.
Con este enfoque, el objetivo del PLACEBA no es slo la mejora de los ingresos econmicos de las familias rurales del Cesar, sino tambin el empoderamiento de las comunidades indgenas, promoviendo la inclusin social y econmica, la conservacin de los conocimientos ancestrales y la adopcin de nuevas tecnologas agroecolgicas para una produccin sostenible y resiliente (figura 2).

Antecedentes
El departamento del Cesar es un territorio vulnerable a la variabilidad climtica, afectado por este fenmeno en 47,8% de su rea. En este sentido, son numerosos los registros de deterioro ambiental por actividad antrpica, alta susceptibilidad al cambio y variabilidad climtica en el Caribe seco, al igual que la inseguridad alimentaria durante las temporadas ms secas del ao (CORPOICA-MAPA, 2015). La ecorregin Sierra nevada es un ambiente megadiverso donde se presentan todos los pisos trmicos. Sin embargo, se han registrado fuertes conflictos ambientales especialmente en el uso agrcola del suelo y en la disminucin de la oferta hdrica superficial en algunas temporadas del ao (Hoyos et al., 2019). El pueblo Arhuaco est ubicado a lo largo de todas las zonas de vida de la SNSM y recibi semilla certificada de AGROSAVIA en el ao 2018 (Figura 3). En el ejercicio de autonoma y autodeterminacin han conservado la semilla y a la fecha continan sembrado la variedad de frjol biofortificado AGROSAVIA rojo 43, variedad que se ha mantenido en campo en un rango de siembra entre 600 a 2.200 msnm. La ubicacin de la variedad en zonas de baja vocacin agrcola o donde la oferta bioclimtica es inadecuada para el frjol, recrudece los problemas ambientales detectados en la Sierra nevada y dificulta la aplicacin de estrategias de produccin agroecolgica. ASOCIT (Asociacin de Autoridades arhuacas), cuenta con un portafolio de productos agroindustriales (cacao, caf, panela) que algunas asociaciones arhuacas han registrado ante el Ministerio de Agricultura y Desarrollo Rural (MADR) como operadores con sello ecolgico (0187 del 2006) con certificadores como BCS KO GARANTIE, lo cual ha permitido la exportacin e ingreso a mercados especializados nacionales y regionales. Por tal razn, se pretende aprovechar esta capacidad endgena construida en otros cultivos y ampliarla al frjol biofortificado AGROSAVIA rojo 43.
Bajo el anterior contexto, en 2022 AgriLAC Resiliente, -una iniciativa del CGIAR para aumentar resiliencia, sostenibilidad y competitividad en Amrica Latina y el Caribe, inicia un acercamiento con Asociacin De Productores Agro Ecolgicos Indgenas Y Campesinos De Las Sierra Nevada De Santa Marta Y Serrana Del Perij ASOANEI para realizar un sondeo rpido de mercado local con la asociacin del cultivo de frjol para identificar conexiones con mercados (ASOANEI y su grupo de inters), articulacin con los enlaces de mercadeo de Agrosavia y del programa de Biofortificados. El protocolo de sondeo rpido tiene como objetivo definir un set de herramientas y/o mtodos para explorar las condiciones de la demanda (asociadas con oportunidades del mercado) de frjol en sistemas alimentarios locales y regionales, con el fin de obtener informacin de los mercados potenciales, clientes y oportunidades de negocio que permita establecer polticas, objetivos y estrategias alrededor del negocio del

Para dar respuesta a las preguntas orientadoras fue necesario realizar indagaciones al interior de ASOANEI para identificar los hbitos de consumo y a nivel de campo la observacin de puntos de venta, entrevistas a comercializadores datos secundarios que provean una visin contextual del comportamiento del sector en la ciudad/regin.
Por otro lado, teniendo en cuenta las particularidades de este pueblo ancestral se incluyeron aspectos como economa propia a nivel del resguardo o listado de inters con actores del territorio que gener un reporte con recomendaciones generales sobre el modelo de mercado. En mayor detalle, la colaboracin entre el equipo de mercado de la Alianza Bioversity - CIAT y el departamento de mercadeo de tecnologas de AGROSAVIA gener una propuesta de sondeo rpido de mercado para su aplicacin por jvenes de ASOANEI. La estrategia incluy dos talleres virtuales a cargo del personal tcnico de ambas instituciones. A partir de este acercamiento se gener un protocolo que se comparti con ASOANEI para que esa entidad priorizara las acciones a realizar como la visita a cuatro supermercados relevantes en Valledupar para la evaluacin de marcas, presentaciones y valores de frjol seco en los diferentes mercados de Valledupar por jvenes Arhuacas del Semillero Fondo Accin de la comunidad Umuriwa. Uno de los principales resultados fue la identificacin de la comercializacin de la variedad biofortificada en uno de los supermercados regionales en un empaque genrico que no reflejaba la promesa de valor nutricional ni su produccin local por la asociacin Asoproagrogar de la Mesa Valledupar. Otro de los aspectos relevantes identificados fue la necesidad de incrementar la base productiva de frjol biofortificado en ASOANEI y la priorizacin de la produccin de grano para el autoabastecimiento. Sin embargo, para los excedentes de autoconsumo se recomend a ASOANEI el posicionamiento del frjol en festivales, ferias y locales propios y tnicos en presentacin empacada y con etiqueta de la asociacin. El ejercicio realizado dio lugar al documento cadena de valor: Frijol en el Departamento del Cesar (Rochel et al., 2023).
Es as como la solucin propuesta est dirigida a la etnia Arhuaca que en su lengua nativa se conoce con el nombre originario Wintukwa; el cual cuenta con una poblacin de alrededor de 43.053 personas (CIT, 2017). Estn regidos por la Ley de origen, por lo cual solo aceptan manejos agroecolgicos en su territorio, viven en la Sierra Nevada de Santa Marta y estn sensibilizados con el desarrollo de actividades propias de su modelo econmico (trueques, mingas) o con la venta de excedentes de cosechas de cultivos agroindustriales como el cacao, la caa y el caf. Teniendo en cuenta que este proyecto incluye un modelo intercultural basado en la Ley de origen, otros grupos tnicos como los Kankuamos asentados en los municipios con reas aptas para frijol en La Sierra Nevada en los municipios de Pueblo Bello y Valledupar tambin podran ser considerados como beneficiarios indirectos, pues se rigen por la misma ley de origen y tienen problemas de desnutricin. Ambas etnias tienen emprendimientos agroindustriales en productos como panela, caf y cacao, lo que podra facilitar la diversificacin hacia otros emprendimientos comerciales con cultivos tradicionales como el frijol, el maz y el arroz. En este sentido, el resguardo Arhuaco tiene el reconocimiento como gobierno autnomo por el ministerio del interior de Colombia, de acuerdo con el plan de salvaguarda que considera acciones en busca de la soberana alimentaria. Es as como el PLACEBA se articula con los aspectos bsicos del plan de salvaguarda pues incluye como primer vector, la promocin de la siembra y consumo de productos con alto valor nutricional en dietas propias y mediante produccin intercultural agroecolgica se logra una fuerte congruencia con diferentes indicadores de este plan as:

Anlisis del Entorno
El pueblo Iku o Arhuaco habita las cuencas altas de los ros Aracataca, Fundacin y Ariguan en la vertiente occidental de la SNSM, en jurisdiccin de los departamentos del Cesar, La Guajira y Magdalena con una poblacin que asciende a 34.711 individuos en 2018, de los cuales el 44% son menores de 14 aos y el 52,8% son mayores de 15 y menores de 64 aos. El 92,3% de la poblacin est asentada en el Cesar, Pueblo Bello (12.180) y Valledupar (8.169), Fundacin (5.133); en Magdalena en Aracataca (2.770) y Santa Marta (2.183); mientras que en Guajira se registran en Dibulla (1.595). Del total poblacional el 35, 2% son analfabetas y 76, 2% habla su lengua nativa (DANE, 2019). Adicional a esto, la poblacin arhuaca reporta ndices significativos de desnutricin crnica y aguda. De acuerdo con la ENSIN (2015), el 24,7% de las etnias del pas ofrecen una dieta mnima aceptable a nios de 6-23 meses respecto al promedio nacional de 37,4 %; retraso en talla en menores de 5 aos en 29,6% en las etnias frente al 10,8% del promedio nacional; el retraso en talla en nios escolares (7-12 aos) tiene un promedio nacional de 7,4% mientras que en las etnias alcanza 29,5%. Esta informacin, se complement con un estudio realizado por Wintukwa IPSI en la que se identificaron 9 de 46 asentamientos con niveles crticos de malnutricin en nios y ancianos Nabusimake, Jerwa, Gun Aruwun, Arwamake, Birwa, Simonorwa, Seykun, Kwageka, Kochukwa (Wintukwa, 2020).
El contexto agroecolgico e intercultural es clave, ya que permite alinear el producto con la creciente demanda de alimentos sostenibles y saludables, mientras se apoya la resiliencia local y la justicia social. La iniciativa Agrilac posibilita la diversificacin del portafolio de productos disponibles proveniente de cultivos biofortificados con maz, batata y yuca, a partir del vnculo de confianza generado con el pueblo Arhuaco, de la armonizacin, aceptacin y bautizo del frjol biofortificado Agrosavia rojo 43, en concordancia con la Ley de origen que los rige (Rozo et al., 2024). El relacionamiento establecido por AGROSAVIA con ASOCIT desde el ao 2016, permiti obviar la necesidad de gestionar oficios con antecedentes del CIAT relacionados con su relacionamiento con otros pueblos que hayan sido consultados para intervenciones de la entidad que representan, de manera que sea posible para el Pueblo Arhuaco verificar la buena fe, idoneidad y honestidad de los interesados en el reconocimiento y respeto de los derechos colectivos de los pueblos y sus autoridades antes de iniciar acciones en el territorio ancestral (CIT, 2017).

El mercado de productos biofortificados puede dirigirse a segmentos conscientes de la salud, programas institucionales de alimentacin, y consumidores interesados en la sostenibilidad. # **You are an AI assistant tasked with evaluating research results from CGIAR (Consultative Group on International Agricultural Research) to determine whether they align with and contribute to CGIAR's objectives in addressing climate change. Your goal is to accurately assign an impact area tag that reflects the relevance and impact of the research on these specific climate change objectives.**

### **Context:**
CGIAR is a global partnership that unites international organizations focused on research for food security. CGIAR has established specific objectives to combat climate change by promoting climate mitigation, adaptation, and policy initiatives, particularly within the agriculture, forestry, and food systems sectors. The research results you will analyze originate from various CGIAR initiatives and projects in these and related fields.

### **Research Result Components:**
Each research result includes the following details:
- **Title:** A brief title summarizing the research result.
- **Description:** A detailed description of the research result, including methods and findings.
- **Research Abstract:** A summary of key findings and implications (optional).
- **Research Parsed Text:** The parsed text of the research result (optional).

### **Tagging Criteria:**
Assign a climate change impact tag using the following criteria:

- **0 = Not Targeted:** 
  - The research does not address or contribute to CGIAR's climate change objectives, such as mitigation, adaptation, or policy.
  - The research is unrelated to climate change, focusing instead on different topics with no significant implications for climate-related outcomes.
  - Example: A study focused solely on agricultural yield improvement without considering its impact on climate change.

- **1 = Significant:** 
  - The research makes a meaningful contribution to CGIAR’s climate change objectives, but these are not the primary focus.
  - The research is relevant and provides insights into climate change, but these are secondary to other goals.
  - Example: A study that explores the impact of agricultural practices on crop resilience, indirectly supporting climate adaptation.

- **2 = Principal:** 
  - The primary objective of the research is to address and directly impact CGIAR's goals in climate change mitigation, adaptation, or policy.
  - The research would not have been undertaken without the intention to contribute to these specific climate change objectives.
  - Example: A study specifically designed to develop sustainable farming practices aimed explicitly at reducing greenhouse gas emissions.

### **Key Objectives Set by CGIAR:**
- **Climate Mitigation:** Transforming agriculture and forest systems into a net carbon sink by 2050.
- **Climate Adaptation:** Equipping small-scale producers to be more resilient to climate impacts by 2030.
- **Climate Policy:** Supporting countries in implementing National Adaptation Plans (NAPs) and Nationally Determined Contributions (NDCs), and increasing ambition in climate actions by 2030.

### **Instructions:**
1. **Analyze the Title and Abstract:** Determine whether the research is related to CGIAR's objectives in climate change by looking for relevant keywords or phrases, such as “mitigation,” “adaptation,” “resilience,” or “climate policy.”
2. **Review the Description and Parsed Text:** Assess whether the research directly contributes to CGIAR’s climate change objectives, and how integral these objectives are to the overall study.
3. **Assign the Tag:** Based on the criteria provided, assign the most appropriate tag (0, 1, or 2) that reflects whether the research is related to and impacts CGIAR’s objectives in climate change.
4. **Provide a Brief Justification:** Explain why you assigned this tag, referencing specific aspects of the research that influenced your decision. Make sure to clarify how the research aligns (or does not align) with CGIAR’s climate change objectives.

### **Important Notes:**
- If the research does not relate to CGIAR's objectives in climate change, assign a tag of **0** (Not Targeted).
- If the research mentions climate change as an important consideration but not the primary focus, assign a tag of **1** (Significant).
- If climate change mitigation, adaptation, or policy is the primary objective of the research, assign a tag of **2** (Principal).
- When assigning a tag of **2**, ensure that the evidence clearly demonstrates that climate change objectives were the main goals of the research and fundamental to its design.

### **Structured Output Format:**
Please provide your answer in the following format:
{ "score": <0|1|2>, "explanation": "<Your explanation here>" }

Be careful to determine whether the research is truly aligned with CGIAR's specific goals in addressing climate change.**

En el marco de la alianza entre Agrosavia, ASOANEI y Agrilac, este ltimo entreg un protocolo para ser implementado por representantes de la comunidad arhuaca, que incluye el sondeo de mercados, la bsqueda de informacin secundaria, la observacin en puntos de venta sirvi como aporte para la construccin del PLACEBA. El Plan de Comercializacin y Emprendimiento para productos biofortificados Arhuacos  PLACEBA, es una propuesta que combina la generacin de estrategias de mercadeo de los productos tnicos, con la formacin en emprendimiento para los miembros de las comunidades indgenas Arhuacos en el departamento de Cesar en el norte de Colombia, con el fin de fortalecer capacidades para la creacin de empresas individuales o colectivas, lideradas por mujeres indgenas (en lo posible) bajo el modelo productivo agroecolgico intercultural, el cual se centra en cultivos bsicos como el maz, la batata, el frijol y la yuca, todos con una caracterstica en comn: que son productos biofortificados con mayores contenidos nutricionales que otros alimentos, para combatir la malnutricin en las comunidades locales. La propuesta PLACEBA adems de promover el autoconsumo, busca tambin consolidar el agronegocio a travs de un plan de vinculacin tecnolgica con enfoque tnico y de gnero, donde las comunidades indgenas (con nfasis en la participacin de las mujeres), se integren como protagonistas en los sistemas agroalimentarios en diversos eslabones como la produccin, transformacin y comercializacin de estos alimentos biofortificados promovidos por la iniciativa Agrilac Resiliente en el departamento de Cesar en alianza con AGROSAVIA. Se pretende tambin, incrementar los indicadores de autonoma alimentaria del pueblo Arhuaco en comunidades priorizadas por su estado nutricional precario, a partir de la difusin del frjol biofortificado y favorecer la venta de excedentes a precios justos, debida a la disminucin de la intermediacin. Dadas las caractersticas de la tecnologa local de produccin del pueblo Arhuaco, el incremento en reas sembradas no afectar la generacin de emisiones de gases de efecto invernadero en las zonas cultivadas con frjol. Asimismo, se mejorar la articulacin econmica del pueblo originario con su entorno regional, a partir de las ventas resultantes de un esquema comercial de ciclo corto basado en las Tecnologas de la Informacin y las Comunicaciones (TIC) y la promocin en redes sociales.
El PLACEBA rene un conjunto de estrategias que permitirn orientar a las comunidades del pueblo Arhuaco y las instituciones aliadas para identificar y alcanzar sus objetivos en un tiempo determinado. En la figura 1, se describen los principales componentes de un plan de comercializacin, que a su vez debe considerar la descripcin general del emprendimiento, determinar el punto de partida o situacin actual, establecer los objetivos comerciales, el mercado objetivo y las estrategias comerciales para lograr los objetivos en determinado tiempo (trimestral, semestral o anual), estableciendo la ruta de accin y seguimiento. Adems, este plan de comercializacin debe coincidir con los enfoques del emprendimiento, por lo cual es necesario incluir la generacin de la misin y visin en esta fase en el proceso con la poblacin diferencial indgena.
